Key Match Events: Jesús Sánchez knocked the go-ahead ninth-inning homer in the Marlins’ 9-8 comeback victory over the Rockies on Tuesday night
Post-Match Reflections: The Marlins play by the Dominican Republic rules, starting with the double six tile. If the same people are competing, whoever won the last round starts things off.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Marlins’ top dominoes player among a group that included Cristian Pache, Ali Sánchez, Sandy Alcantara, Jesús Luzardo, Edward Cabrera, Otto Lopez and Valente Bellozo
Others: The game ends when someone runs out of tiles to win. The loser is determined by the person with the highest point total as determined by the numbers on his remaining tiles, and he gets kicked out of his seat for someone else to take his place.
During pregame, the loser has to drink a half bottle of water. Postgame, it’s 10 pushups.
